Building a Modern Personal Website with Astro

AstroWeb DevelopmentJavaScript
By Chunjie Liu

When I decided to rebuild my personal website, I wanted something that was fast, modern, and easy to maintain. After exploring various options, I chose Astro for its unique approach to static site generation and its excellent developer experience.

Why Astro?

Astro stands out from other static site generators for several reasons:

  • Zero JavaScript by default: Astro ships zero JavaScript to the client by default, making sites incredibly fast.
  • Component Islands: You can add interactive components only where needed, keeping the rest of your site static.
  • Framework agnostic: Use React, Vue, Svelte, or any other framework components within the same project.
  • Developer experience: Great tooling, TypeScript support, and intuitive file-based routing.

Getting Started

Setting up an Astro project is straightforward. You can start with their CLI tool: 

npm create astro@latest my-website

This will scaffold a new Astro project with everything you need to get started.

Project Structure

A typical Astro project has a clean, intuitive structure:

  • src/pages/ - Your website pages (supports .astro, .md, .js files)
  • src/layouts/ - Reusable layout components
  • src/components/ - UI components
  • public/ - Static assets

Key Features I Used

For this website, I leveraged several Astro features:

Layout Components

I created a base layout that includes the navigation, footer, and common meta tags. This ensures consistency across all pages while keeping the code DRY.

Static Site Generation

All pages are pre-rendered at build time, resulting in lightning-fast loading speeds and excellent SEO performance.

TypeScript Support

Astro has excellent TypeScript support out of the box, which helps catch errors early and improves the development experience.

Performance Benefits

The performance benefits of using Astro are immediately noticeable:

  • Near-instant page loads due to pre-rendered HTML
  • Minimal JavaScript bundle sizes
  • Excellent Core Web Vitals scores
  • SEO-friendly static HTML

Conclusion

Building this website with Astro has been a great experience. The framework strikes an excellent balance between simplicity and power, making it perfect for personal websites, blogs, and even more complex projects.

If you're considering building a new website or rebuilding an existing one, I highly recommend giving Astro a try. Its focus on performance, developer experience, and flexibility makes it a compelling choice for modern web development.
